1:
God, you are the God whom I worship.\q1 I greatly desire to be with you
\q2 as a person in a dry hot wilderness greatly desires some water.
\q1
2:
I have been with you in your temple\q1 In order to see that you are loving and powerful.


\q1
3:
You always love me, as you promised in your covenant; this is worth more than my entire life,\q2 so I will always praise you.
\q1
4:
I will praise you all the time that I live;\q2 I will lift up my hands to you while I pray.


\q1
5:
You fill me up and you meet every need I have.\q2 My response to you is much like when I eat a delicious banquet of rich foods
\q2 and the food fills me.
\q2 I will have great happiness when I praise you with the words that I speak about you.
\q1
6:
While I lie on my bed, I think about you.\q1 I think about you all during the night.


\q1
7:
For you have always helped me,\q2 and I sing joyfully knowing that you protect me
\q2 as a bird protects her young under her wings.
\q1
8:
I follow you closely,\q2 and your hand protects me.



\q1
9:
But those who are trying to kill me\q2 will die and descend into the place of the dead;
\q1
10:
they will be killed in battles\q2 and their corpses will be eaten by dogs.



\q1
11:
But I, the king of Israel, will rejoice in what God has done;\q2 and all those who ask God to confirm their word will praise him,
\q2 but he will not allow liars to say anything.
